moves.1. e4: here i began another game in high hopes and an aim to win
moves.1... b6: but i also wanted to do something different to my usual e4, so i decided to try and play something like the 'modern' opening
moves.2... e6: here i am, only moving my pawns to the 6th row!
moves.3. Bc4: white played the very common Bc4
moves.3... Nf6: but now it is time for other pieces apart from pawns to advance
moves.4... d5: i'm now in a more agressive mood
moves.5. exd5: a very likely move (other option is to play something like e5?)
moves.5... exd5: not going to stay a pawn down
moves.6. Qe2+: white wants an early check to keep this game rolling
moves.6... Be7: probably my best option apart from Be6
moves.7... c6: i play my pawn pushing again
moves.8. Ba4: that has forced that all to powerful bishop back where it belongs (somewhere useless)
moves.8... O-O: i take the oppurtunity to play rook out
moves.9... Re8: now i am in the hope of getting that queen which could mean trouble for white, unless it does something about it soon!
moves.10... Bc5: but that wasn't that good a move after all
moves.11. O-O: that is one of the possible ways to escape the pin that is possible
moves.11... d4: but that still doesn't prevent me playing that
moves.12. Nxd4: but i wasn't to forget that, though i still come out better from that swap off
moves.12... Bxd4: what else could you expect there?
moves.13. Qf3: now he is after my pawns!
moves.13... Bg4: but it is my oppurtunity make use of more pieces and get into the attack!
moves.14. Qf4: that has atleast got the queen from threatening my pawn as it was previously
moves.14... Be5: but i desperately want that queen
moves.15. Qc4: okay- he still wants the pawn!
moves.15... b5: but that was a total mistake- i love pushing pawns!
moves.16... cxb5: but i'm now further in the lead
moves.17... Nbd7: lets play more defensive now and take the oppurtunity to play that knight out
moves.18. Bg5: going for a mighty pin which could disrupt my position!
moves.18... Be6: but i'm in serious need of that queen to be thrashing my oponent properly!
moves.19... Bxc4: a blunder? or was it a big trick
moves.20. Bxc4: atleast i got what i wanted though i lost my rather altruistic bishop
moves.22. Rxe8+: escaping that trauma with that rook swap off!
moves.23... Rb8: but i want the other rook as well
moves.24. Rb3: why ever would white play that
moves.24... Qe1#: the inevitable and on white's part rather unsuspected CHECKMATE! Yay for me!
